data.title: Multi-selection property editing with folders
data.body:
Currently if the selection contains any folders, the property grid shows no editable properties.

Desired behavior:
Be able to set the build action, processor, and any other properties you would be able to as part of a normal multiselection - for all items beneath the selected folder. 

Problem case:
A project with a very deep folder heirarchy beneath "Content/XmlData". You include the folder into the project. It automatically sets them to action: build, importer: xmlimporter but you want them all to be action: copy. There is unfortunately no way to easily select all these items to edit at the same time. When you have thousands of items spread across hundreds of subfolders this becomes -quite- tedious.

data.title: Mouse GetState() creates garbage.
data.body:
As said calling GetState() creates garbage that is collected and i have no clue how or if it is possible to keep a live reference to it in order to prevent it from being collected.

Running in a near empty project at about 3500 fps it creates about 1 megabyte of garbage in a minute. 
Its quite annoying not because its a huge amount but because its a constant source of garbage that basically must be on. If you want to have mouse functionality in your game.

data.title: Add GLFX format support to 2MGFX
Game Events (InitializationEvent, LoadContentEvent, etc)
data.body:
There should be pre, execution, and post events for things in the Game class.

base.Initialize and other overridden methods shouldn't rely on being executed last, and could benefit by being called one after another wherever the first get's called, instead of being chained.

A use case for an InitializationEvent in the pre execution state would be as follows:
Initializing classes that are required before Initialization gets called. I realize this is a broad use case, but it covers a lot of different scenarios.

- Search for "MonoGame"
- Note that 3.6 builds show up
- Search for "monogame" or "Monogame"
- Note that only 3.5 builds show up

I guess it's not a gigantic problem but it did waste 24 hours of my time before I figured it out and I imagine I'm not the only one who has had this problem.

data.title: WindowsDX fullscreen debug causes soft-lock
v3.5.1+ ContentManager.Unload() doesn't seem to free up memory
data.body:
After upgrading from 3.4 to 3.5.1 (and then 3.6) I noticed that calling ContentManager.Unload() doesn't lessen the amount of memory being used by the game, as seen in the Diagnostic Tools of VS2015 and the Resource Monitor on Windows. Loading, unloading, then reloading the same content would originally keep the memory usage about the same, but now it continues to increase during every Load() while not decreasing during Unload(). 

I tested this further by installing v3.4 again and using the same project and code. Loading and unloading the same content as before now has the desired effect where the memory usage increases during Load() and decreases after Unload(), as expected.

data.title: Fallbacks if the preferred render target formats are not supported
data.body:
DirectX 11 (DXGI 1.1) does not support 16-bit surface formats Bgr565, Bgra5551 or Bgra4444 for render targets.  DirectX 11.1 (DXGI 1.2) does support these surface formats for render targets.
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ff471325(v=vs.85).aspx

This change implements a check for the support of the requested format and falls back to `SurfaceFormat.Color` and `DepthStencilFormat.Depth24Stencil8` if the requested formats are not supported.

data.title: Low latency Mouse input
data.body:
Create a working thread to process Mouse input.

Fixes https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/4897, https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/issues/5300, http://community.monogame.net/t/keyboard-input-caused-by-mouse/8203/9.

data.title: Fix bug in ByteBufferPool
data.body: This class is used for dynamic sound effect buffers. `_freeBuffers` are ordered by size and the lookup depends on it because it does a binary search. When implementing this I made a silly mistake that would mess up the order.
